statements: SELECT * FROM user_permissions;
SELECT user_id, feature_name FROM user_permissions WHERE access_level > 1;
SELECT feature_name, access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE user_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM user_permissions WHERE user_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000' AND feature_name = 'Settings';
SELECT user_id, feature_name, access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE access_level BETWEEN 1 AND 3;
SELECT * FROM user_permissions ORDER BY user_id DESC, access_level ASC;
SELECT feature_name, access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE access_level > 2 ORDER BY feature_name;
SELECT user_id, feature_name FROM user_permissions WHERE user_id IN ('123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000', '345e6789-f12d-45a6-8b23-456781234000');
SELECT DISTINCT access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE feature_name LIKE 'admin%';
SELECT * FROM user_permissions WHERE feature_name = 'profile' ORDER BY user_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM user_permissions;
SELECT user_id, access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE feature = 'login';
SELECT id, feature FROM feature_access WHERE default_access_level > 2;
SELECT * FROM user_permissions ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT feature FROM user_permissions;
SELECT * FROM user_permissions WHERE user_id = 1 AND access_level > 2;
SELECT feature, access_level FROM user_permissions WHERE access_level = (SELECT MIN(access_level) FROM user_permissions);
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS num_permissions FROM user_permissions GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT feature, MAX(access_level) AS max_access_level FROM user_permissions GROUP BY feature;
SELECT u.user_id, u.feature, f.default_access_level FROM user_permissions u JOIN feature_access f ON u.feature = f.feature;
SELECT * FROM Users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT feature_name FROM Features ORDER BY feature_name DESC;
SELECT username, email FROM Users WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT user_id, access_level FROM UserPermissions WHERE access_level > 1;
SELECT feature_name, feature_id FROM Features ORDER BY feature_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM UserPermissions WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Features ORDER BY feature_name DESC;

SELECT Users.username, Features.feature_name FROM Users JOIN UserPermissions ON Users.user_id = UserPermissions.user_id JOIN Features ON UserPermissions.feature_id = Features.feature_id WHERE Users.username = 'John';

SELECT Users.email, Features.feature_name, UserPermissions.access_level FROM Users JOIN UserPermissions ON Users.user_id = UserPermissions.user_id JOIN Features ON UserPermissions.feature_id = Features.feature_id WHERE Features.feature_name = 'Admin' AND UserPermissions.access_level > 1;
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Users.user_id) AS total_users FROM Users;
SELECT * FROM user_roles;
SELECT role_name FROM roles;
SELECT feature_id, feature_name FROM features ORDER BY feature_id ASC;
SELECT role_id, role_name FROM roles WHERE role_id > 3;
SELECT role_id, feature_id, permission FROM role_permissions WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM user_roles WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE role_id = 2;
SELECT feature_name, permission FROM features JOIN role_permissions ON features.feature_id = role_permissions.feature_id WHERE role_permissions.role_id = 1;
SELECT user_id, role_name FROM user_roles JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT role_id, COUNT(*) AS permission_count FROM role_permissions GROUP BY role_id;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users ORDER BY username ASC;
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT username, role_name FROM users JOIN roles ON users.user_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(role_id) AS role_count FROM user_roles GROUP BY user_id HAVING role_count > 1;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY role_name DESC;

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id;
SELECT u.username, COUNT(ur.role_id) AS num_roles FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id GROUP BY u.username HAVING num_roles > 1;
